entry.title: Not able to create sales order with reference of schedule agreement VA01
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

Actually, I configured a new schedule agreement for one of our clients. Now they want to create a sales order with reference to the schedule agreement, but whenever we are given all the inputs and try to create in VA01 it while saving the order, the sales order is generated, but when we are trying to open it in VA02, the system is throwing an error message like the one below. So any experts, please guide me if I missed any configuration.

SD document 1031666 is not in the database or has been archived

Regard's,

Pavan Kumar

Kindly advise to solve this.

Regards,
Rajesh

entry.title: Down Payment with partial deliveries
entry.content:
Hello,

I have this scenario to cover:

  1. Sales Order creation with Down payment (milestone billing plan)
  2. After payment of DP in SAP FI, multiple deliveries can be issued based on Sales Order.
  3. Invoicing based on each delivery, taking into account the initial DP

Ex :

  • Sales Order (1000Eur)
  • Down Payment of 500Eur created and paid in accounting
  • 1st partial delivery > invoicing of products concerned by this 1st partial delivery: invoice 1 (600Eur)
  • 2nd partial delivery for Backorder > invoicing of products concerned by this 2nd partial delivery: invoice 2 (400Eur)

Invoice 1 Total amount = amount of delivered products – amount of DP = 600 – 500 = 100Eur

Invoice 2 Total amount = 400 – 0 = 400Eur  

Is this scenario possible to manage? It seems that, with milestone billing plan, you can only invoice based on order. My need is to invoice based on each delivery made, taking into account the DP amount on each of these invoices.

Thanks for your reply

entry.title: Packing Instruction- Lids on the top layer of the pallet
entry.content:
Good morning. I have a question — I was asked to create a packing instruction for deliveries, but the particularity of this one is that it must include lids only on the top layer of the pallet. The ideal case is to place 6 layers of 9 boxes, which gives a total of 54 boxes, and only the top 9 boxes should have these lids. However, the thing is that full pallets won’t always be shipped — sometimes there will be partial shipments, for example, 18 boxes, 13 boxes, etc. Is there a way to configure this rule so that only the top boxes carry the lid? 

I don´t know if there´s any other option that I can use in POP1 

Best Regards

entry.title: Retention in SD
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

I would appreciate your guidance on how to handle the retention cycle in SD.

My client requires a specific percentage to be retained from each billing document, which the customer will settle at a later stage. The requirement is to post the retention amount to the customer account using a Special G/L indicator directly from the SD billing document.

Scenario Overview:

  • The retention amount is determined in the sales order using a dedicated condition type.

  • This value flows into the billing document.

  • The goal is for the system to post the retention amount to a customer line item with a Special G/L indicator during billing itself.

Example:

Document Total: 1000
Less Retention (10%): 100
Subtotal: 900
VAT (5%): 45
Net Payable: 945

Expected Accounting Entry from Billing:

Account Debit Credit

Customer (Normal)1045 
Revenue 1000
VAT 45
Customer – Special G/L (Retention)100 
Customer  100

Issue:

When generating the billing document, the system does not allow posting to a customer account with a Special G/L indicator from SD. Hence, we are unable to split the receivable between the normal and retention portions automatically during billing.

Request:

  • Is it technically feasible to post the retention amount to a Special G/L customer line directly from the SD billing document?

  • If not, what is the best practice or recommended workaround for handling this requirement?

  • Are there any standard enhancements (exits, BADIs, VOFM routines) or post-billing processes to achieve this split posting?

Any suggestions, guidance, or shared experiences would be highly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your support!

Best regards,
Silambarasan R

entry.title: Modify VWPOS in a Enhancement to determine a new item category during sales order creation VA01
entry.content:
Dear SD and ABAP Experts,

There is a requirement in my project to modify the value of VWPOS during sales order creation to a new specific value (eg. ZJPC) which will be configured in "SPRO > Sales and Distribution > Basic Functions > Sales > Sales Documents > Sales Document Item > Define Item Category Usage" to enable item category to be determined as "TANN".

The Item Category determination configuration in VOV4 (or) "SPRO > Sales and Distribution > Basic Functions > Sales > Sales Documents > Sales Document Item > Assign Item Categories" will be also be configured with following values - 

Sales Order Type = ZOR, Item Category Group = NORM, Item Usage = ZJPC, Higher level item category = "Blank", Default Item Category = TANN"

To achieve this i would like to know which is the proper User-exit (or) BADI to implement this enhancement of modifying the Item Usage (VWPOS) field during sales order creation in S4 On-Premise system?

entry.title: How to Make Attachment Mandatory Before Saving in VA01 (Sales Order Creation)?
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

One of my clients has a requirement to make it mandatory to attach a document before saving a sales order in VA01 and VA02.

I successfully implemented the check in VA02 by using the USEREXIT_SAVE_DOCUMENT_PREPARE in MV45AFZZ, where the sales order number is already available, and I could restrict the save based on the attachment check.

However, in VA01, since the sales order number is generated only after saving, I'm unable to validate whether an attachment is present before the document is saved.

Has anyone faced a similar scenario?
Is there a way to check for attachments or enforce this validation in VA01 before the sales order is created?
Any BADI or User Exit suggestions or workaround approaches would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

Best regards,

Mannem Leelamohan

entry.title: Avoid creation of duplicate condition contract
entry.content:
Dear Expert,

We are using SAP S/4  HANA-2023 on premise. system is allowing to create duplicate condition contract (for same customer, same validity period & same conditions). there is no duplicate entry check if there is an identical condition contract.

Can you please check what configuration is required to avoid creation of duplicate condition contract?

Thank you,

Rahul

entry.title: Long street name issue during customer master load/update via LSMW
entry.content:
Dears,
I need to update quite a lot of customer records by adding a long street name (up to 60 characters). However, I'm running into an issue when using LSMW.

In VD02 transaction, SAP allows entering a street name up to 60 characters. But in the LSMW recording, only 35 characters are available in the street field (including the building number). The screen layout during recording also looks slightly different from what I see in VD02 – see the screenshot attached. I’ve observed a similar issue when trying to use direct input (object 0050 / program RFBIDE00).

I understand that the KNA1-STRAS field is limited to 35 characters, but still, I need to load longer street names (like in VD02) for around 100 customers. It's SAP ECC 6.0.

Is there a way to handle this using LSMW?

Regards
Krzysztof

entry.title: No customer master record exists for sold-to party - Message No. VP199 - No customer master in KNVV
entry.content:
Tried creating a sales order and getting this issue.

Have maintained the below configurations.
Cross-Application Components - SAP Business Partner - Business Partner - Basic Settings - Business Partner Roles - Define BP Roles

Cross-Application Components - SAP Business Partner - Business Partner - Basic Settings - Number Ranges and Groupings - Define Groupings and Assign Number Ranges

Financial Accounting - Accounts Receivable and Accounts Payable - Customer Accounts - Master Data - Preparations for Creating Customer Master Data - Define Account Groups with Screen Layout (Customers)

Financial Accounting - Accounts Receivable and Accounts Payable - Customer Accounts - Master Data - Preparations for Creating Customer Master Data - Assign Number Ranges to Customer Account Groups

Master Data Synchronization - Customer/Vendor Integration - Business Partner Settings - Settings for Customer Integration - 
Field Assignment for Customer Integration - Assign Keys - Define Number Assignment for Direction BP to Customer

in VOPA assigned the AG to all SP, SH, PY, BP.

AG updated in BP. Customer number generated in BP

Customer displaying in VA01 search box but still error.

But still getting issue in va01. Checked online got no answer. since asking
At last the customer data is not available in KNVV and KNVP table. Am I missing any

entry.title: Default Loading Group in Material Master to Prevent Shipping Point Error
entry.content:
We are encountering the following SAP SD error during sales order processing:

Ship.condition 01 loading grp plant MY18 StLoc FG91 not defined (V1358)

This happens when the Loading Group (LOSGR) is missing or not maintained in the material master, causing shipping point determination to fail.

Is there a way to default the Loading Group value (e.g., '0001') automatically in the material master when it is not maintained, either through configuration or enhancement (user exit/BADI)?

  • If yes, what is the recommended approach to ensure all new and existing materials have a valid Loading Group to prevent this error?

  • If this requires an ABAP enhancement, could you please advise on the recommended user exit or BADI to use for auto-populating the Loading Group during material creation or change?

entry.title: Pricing - Condition activate with requirements
entry.content: I wrote a requirement on pricing to activate or deactivate a price condition. At the moment when the requirement sets the sy-subrc = 0, the condition does not trigger automatically and a repricing is needed. How can I resolve this? All of this in the sales order.

entry.title: Where are exchange rates actually used in business processes (FI, MM, SD)?
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’ve successfully configured the automatic exchange rate import via the MRM module.
Now I’m trying to better understand where exactly these rates are applied in real business processes.

I’m aware that FI, MM, and SD (and possibly other modules) are impacted.
However, I’m still looking for concrete use cases or documentation that describe how and where the exchange rate is used – for example, in sales documents, purchase orders, or billing. I’d like to include a clear use case for all Moduls in our group-wide rollout showing where exchange rates impact business processes in SAP.

Is there a clear overview, real-life example, or detailed explanation of which transactions or document types rely on exchange rates?

Thanks a lot in advance and best regards,
Simon

However, when I activate them, they do not appear in the base parameterization layout... is this correct?Do I have to create my own layout? How can I then make it the default for all users (without them having to create it themselves)?

 

Thank you.

entry.title: Sale price record VK11 upto 5 decimals
entry.content:
Hello Everyone, As per SAP standards, the system allows up to 2 decimals in the price record, but our requirement is to have up to 5 decimals. For such cases, SAP’s recommendation is to maintain the record using units like per 10PC, 100PC, etc. However, we have encountered situations where human errors in performing these calculations have resulted in significant revenue discrepancies. Hence, I would like to understand if we have any SAP recommendation.

Proposed a solution to have additional columns in standard mass sales price app where you will enter price upto 5 digits and system does automatic calculation to put upto 2 decimals (attached PP for your reference).

we also thought of duplicating and creating new custom currency type that allows more decimal places. But we have already gone live with 3 sites and implementing this would cause inconsistencies.
